sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jane Doe is being referred to the Rheumatology Department for further evaluation and management of persistent joint pain and swelling, which has not responded to initial conservative treatment.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: Ms. Doe reports a six-month history of intermittent pain, stiffness, and swelling in her hands and wrists, particularly in the morning. Symptoms have progressively worsened, and she now experiences difficulty performing daily activities. There is no history of trauma. Over-the-counter analgesics have provided minimal relief.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: Ms. Doe has a history of mild hypothyroidism, currently managed with levothyroxine. She has no known drug allergies. Family history is significant for rheumatoid arthritis in her mother.

sections.heading: Assessment
sections.content: On examination, there is synovial thickening and tenderness in both wrists and the proximal interphalangeal joints of both hands. Laboratory investigations reveal mildly elevated ESR (28 mm/hr) and positive anti-CCP antibodies. Radiographs of the hands show no erosive changes.

sections.heading: Plan and Recommendations
sections.content: Ms. Doe is being referred for specialist assessment to confirm the diagnosis and discuss disease-modifying therapy. Current management includes NSAIDs as needed and continuation of thyroid medication. Please consider further immunological workup and initiation of DMARDs as appropriate.
